name: Something For Everyone? Trivia Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: Steve Redgrave won a record 5th gold medal at the Sydney Olympics, in which sport?
questions.explanation:
Rowing.

	Steve Redgrave comes from the town of Marlow on the River Thames, a centre for rowing.

questions.text: Where are most of the Kings of France buried?
questions.explanation:
St Denis.

	St Denis is an ancient cathedral in a suburb north of Paris.

questions.text: Who in Greek legend was the enchantress who turned men into swine?
questions.explanation:
Circe.

	Circe was one of the characters encountered in the Odyssey

questions.text: Where does the Northern Ireland assembly sit?
questions.explanation:
Stormont.

	The Assembley sits at Stormont. Sunningdale is the name of the agreement which saw the previous devolved government in the 1970s.

questions.text: Which novelist created the characters Elizabeth Bennett, Mr Darcy and Lady Catherine de Burgh?
questions.explanation:
Jane Austen.

	They are leading characters in Pride and Prejudice.

questions.text: Which is the orbital motorway around London?
questions.explanation:
M25.

	The M25 has twice been widened in parts to deal with the huge volumes of traffic. It is sometimes referred to as the largest car park in the UK....

questions.text: Egg and Smile are brands of?
questions.explanation:
E-bank.

	Part of the new wave of on-line financial services.

Leon.

	Lenin's rival, he escaped from Russia to Latin America but was murdered in exile.

questions.text: In which country is the beautiful medieval city of Bruges?
questions.explanation:
Belgium.

	Bruges is in Belgium. Its Flemish name is Brugge and its nearby port is Zeebrugge.

Hindu.

	Diwali is the Hindu new year, also known as the Festival of Light.
